intro: Cyphostemma uter, commonly known as the desert milkvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are often clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is adapted to arid environments. Cyphostemma uter is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
